title: Magic UI

headings.text: Companies choose Magic UI to build their landing pages.
Here are some of the components that you can use to build your landing pages.
What People Are Saying on Twitter

aiAnalysis:
Here's a summary of the key points from the Magic UI website:

Main Highlights:
- Magic UI is a Tailwind v4 UI library for design engineers, with over 150 free and open-source animated components and effects built with React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Motion.
- It's positioned as a perfect companion to the shadcn/ui library.
- The website showcases various companies that have used Magic UI to build their landing pages, including startups that have raised funding.

Key Features:
- Extensive collection of pre-built, animated UI components and effects to accelerate web development.
- Built with modern web technologies like React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Motion.
- Open-source and free to use.
- Integrates well with the shadcn/ui library.

Showcase:
- The website highlights various customer case studies, including startups that have used Magic UI and gone on to raise funding (e.g. anara.com, aomni.com, cognosys.ai, infisical.com, langfuse.com, llm.report, million.dev, querylab.ai, trysherpa.bot, undrstnd.dev, writora.xyz).
- These examples demonstrate how Magic UI can be leveraged to build high-quality, visually-appealing landing pages and websites.

In summary, Magic UI appears to be a comprehensive, open-source UI library that provides design engineers with a rich set of animated components and effects to rapidly build modern, visually-appealing web applications and landing pages. The showcase of customer use cases highlights its practical applications and value proposition.
